com.guardtime.envelope.verification.rule

Interface Rule<V>

  • Type Parameters:
    V - Verifiable object class.
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractRule, AnnotationDataExistenceRule, AnnotationDataIntegrityRule, AnnotationsManifestExistenceRule, AnnotationsManifestIntegrityRule, DocumentExistenceRule, DocumentIntegrityRule, DocumentsManifestExistenceRule, DocumentsManifestIntegrityRule, MultiHashElementIntegrityRule, SignatureExistenceRule, SignatureIntegrityRule, SignatureSignsManifestRule, SingleAnnotationManifestExistenceRule, SingleAnnotationManifestIntegrityRule, TrustedHashAlgorithmExistenceRule, TrustedHashListIntegrityRule, UnimplementedHashAlgorithmExistenceRule

    public interface Rule<V>
    Rule to be performed during verification of Envelope or its components.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      String getErrorMessage() 
      String getName() 
      boolean verify(ResultHolder resultHolder, V verifiable)
      Verifies V to produce a list of RuleVerificationResult which are added to the provided ResultHolder.

    • Method Detail

      • verify

        boolean verify(ResultHolder resultHolder,
               V verifiable)
        throws RuleTerminatingException
        Verifies V to produce a list of RuleVerificationResult which are added to the provided ResultHolder. Depending on the implementation, there can be nested Rules used during verification.
        Parameters:
        verifiable - object to be examined.
        resultHolder - that maintains all rule verification results.
        Returns:
        True, unless the verification process is ignored.
        Throws:
        RuleTerminatingException - when the verification process at this level can not be continued due to the situation encountered during processing the rule. Passes any decision of continuing verification to higher level invoker of verification.

      • getName

        String getName()
        Returns:
        Unique string which can be used to identify the type of the rule.

      • getErrorMessage

        String getErrorMessage()
        Returns:
        Error string of the rule that applies when the rule results in a not OK state.
